intro: Govenia vilcabambana, commonly known as the Vilcabamba orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant features long, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated by enthusiasts but remains relatively rare in the wild.
